de.ralleytn.simple.input

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ralleytn.simple.input.Device
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Gamepad, Keyboard, Mouse

    public abstract class Device
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an input device.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)

      void setTimeBetweenUpdates(long millis)
      Sets how long the thread will wait after an update.
      void startListening()
      Starts the thread that listens to the input events of this device.
      void stopListening()

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeBetweenUpdates

        public void setTimeBetweenUpdates(long millis)
        Sets how long the thread will wait after an update. Default value is 10.
        Parameters:
        millis - the time the thread will wait in milliseconds
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
        Starts the thread that listens to the input events of this device.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • stopListening

        public void stopListening()
        Stops the thread that listens to the input events of this device.
        Since:
        1.0,0

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name of this device (not a unique identifier)
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isListening

        public boolean isListening()
        Returns:
        true if this device currently listens to input events, else false
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getTimeBetweenUpdates

        public long getTimeBetweenUpdates()
        Returns:
        the time between updates in milliseconds
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getPortNumber

        public int getPortNumber()
        Returns:
        the port number of this device (currently always 0)
        Since:
        1.0.0
